content:
# elizaos/elizaos.github.io Weekly Report (Oct 26 - 1, 2025)

## üöÄ Highlights
This week's development focused on enhancing both system performance and community engagement. A significant performance improvement was introduced with an adaptive rate limiting system for GitHub API operations, designed to handle high-volume workloads more efficiently. Concurrently, a new MVP badge system was launched to begin recognizing contributor achievements. The week concluded with the identification of a display bug affecting weekly summary dates, which has been logged for a future fix.

## üõ†Ô∏è Key Developments
Work this week centered on implementing new features for performance and user recognition.

- **GitHub API Performance Enhancement**
  An adaptive rate limiting mechanism was implemented to optimize GitHub API interactions. This feature improves performance for high-volume operations while adding zero overhead for typical workloads, ensuring more efficient data processing ([#160](https://github.com/elizaos/elizaos.github.io/pull/160)).

- **Contributor Recognition with MVP Badge System**
  To foster community engagement, a minimal and efficient badge system was introduced. The initial version includes 5 badge types across 3 tier levels (beginner/elite/legend) and was designed with DRY and YAGNI principles to minimize code overhead ([#161](https://github.com/elizaos/elizaos.github.io/pull/161)).

## üêõ Issues & Triage
Issue management this week was focused on identifying a new bug, with no issues being closed.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** A new display bug was reported concerning the weekly summaries on the leaderboard and user profiles. The issue notes that incorrect dates (specifically "13th-19th July 2025") are being displayed for most summaries ([#168](https://github.com/elizaos/elizaos.github.io/issues/168)). There were no active issues with significant discussion reported this week.

## üí¨ Community & Collaboration
Based on the provided reports, development activity was focused on feature implementation and bug reporting. There were no PRs or issues noted with a high degree of discussion or reviews during this timeframe.
